item.title: Mutualisms, coexistence and clever ways to measure things
item.description:
I recently came across this very cool preprint in which Sarah P. Hammarlund et al. address the question of how several mutualistic parters are maintained in mutualistic networks despite them competing for the same resources. There are quite a few intriguing ideas in this paper. Let's start from the beginning…

  • What is a “mutualism”? What are “mutualistic networks”?
  • Classic ecology would predict exclusion if >1 species compete for an only resource (highest fitness/growth rate wins), so mutualistic networks shouldn't exist
  • Paper results
  • Paper way of assessing coexistence

item.title: Welcome to my blog!
item.description: …but trust me, I am filled with good intentions and plan to update this blog periodically.
